greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Eigentriangle generated from expansion of sin(x)*exp(x), row sums = (2^n - 1).
comment: Row sums = (2^n - 1): (1, 3, 7, 15, 31,...) = INVERT transform of A009545 starting with offset 1. Right border = (1, 1, 3, 7, 15,...).
Left border = A009545, = expansion of sin(x)*exp(x) starting with offset 1.
Sum of row n terms = rightmost term of next row.
formula: A009545 = expansion of sin(x)*exp(x), starting with offset 1: (1, 2, 2, 0, -4, -8, -8,...).

These operations = the following: Matrix A = an infinite lower triangular matrix with rows = A009545 subsequences decrescendo: (1; 2,1; 2,2,1; 0,2,2,1; -4,0,2,2,1;...) and matrix B = an infinite lower triangular matrix with (1, 1, 3, 7, 15,...) in the main diagonal and the rest zeros.
example: First few rows of the triangle =
... Example: row 4 = (0, 2, 6, 7) pairwise product of (0, 2, 2, 1) and (1, 1, 3, 7) = (0*1, 2*1, 2*3, 1*7); where (1, 2, 2, 0,...) = the first 4 terms of A009545 with offset 1.
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 10 2008
